VLIB_createBlobIntervalImg

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_createBlobIntervalImg (VLIB_CCHandle *handle, AVMii *blob_ii, const VLIB_blob *blob)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_createBlobIntervalImg ( VLIB_CCHandle *  handle,
AVMii *  blob_ii,
const VLIB_blob *  blob 
)

Description:
This function constructs the interval image of the blob. The blob is specified by input parameters. The blob interval image is extracted from the global interval image which is the internal result of connected component labeling. So the connected component labeling needs to be performed before calling this module.
Parameters:
[in] handle Pointer to CC handle, the CC handle is used for connected component labeling and contains all the internal results of cc labeling, including the global interval image (VLIB_CCHandle)
[out] blob_ii Pointer to the output interval image of the blob. The buffer size pointed to by this pointer should be be equal to the size parameter returned by the VLIB_getblobIIBufSize function. (AVMii)
[in] blob The pointer to the blob parameter structure (VLIB_blob)
Assumptions:
  • All I/O buffers are assumed to be not aliased.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C66 floating-point processors
Performance Notes:
NA
